View Pick-up locations show map Places to go
Things to see
Car Hire from Galway Airport
Galway airport is located 6km from the city of Galway. The airport offers a range of services and facilities including free Wi-fi, foreign exchange for last minute euros and an information point for passengers. The airport is located just a short drive from superb natural attractions such as Connemara and the Burren in Co. Clare.
Galway is located on the west coast of Ireland and is the sixth largest urban area in the country. The city is known nationwide as the City of the Tribes, a nickname attributed to the fourteen merchant families who led the city during the Hiberno-Norman period of history in Ireland.
Budget Car Hire from Galway Airport is easy with Argus Car Hire…Pay less for car hire in Galway with our low cost deals and all-inclusive prices to suit any budgets.
Things To See in Galway
Galway is famous for its rich arts and cultural programme of festivals and events during the year which include: Galway Arts Festival, which takes place each July, Galway Races Festival which takes place during the July/August Festival at Galway Race Course in Ballybrit and the Galway International Oyster Competition which is a four day event held in September each year.
Things To Do in Galway
The central focus of activity in the city centre is Eyre Square, which if you're walking, is close to the medieval quarter of the city. Eyre Square offers a range of shops, cafés and restaurants.
The nearby towns and villages of Galway offer plenty of attractions to keep everyone amused. Why not hire a car and head out the town of Salthill? The seaside town lies just outside the city and offers a range of activities for active holidaymakers including fishing, swimming and sailing.
Eating Out in Galway
Galway has more restaurants per head of population than any other Irish city so eating out is easy whether you're on a thrifty backpackers budget, or looking to sample the best of the local delights, you're sure to find what you're looking for in Galway.
Those on a spend thrifty budget can enjoy cheap bites at home-grown fast food restaurant chain Supermacs, while those looking for something on the top-end of the price-line should look no further than The Malt House which offers fresh local seafood with a French twist.
Nightlife/Accommodation in Galway
